Interface ISimpleQueryBuilder<T extends Bean>

All Known Subinterfaces:

    • getEntityType

      IEntityType getEntityType()
      Returns:
      the entity type this table is querying on

    • compare

      Restriction<T> compare(IQueryablePropertyInfo column, Relop op, Object value)
      Compares a column against a value given an operation type.

      Value types of Key, Bean, and typekeys are accepted

      A value type of DBFunction is handled as well.

      Parameters:
      column - The column to compare
      op - The operation
      value - The value
      Returns:
      this. Used for the builder pattern

    • compare

      Restriction<T> compare(ColumnRef column, Relop op, Object value)

      Value types of Key, Bean, and typekeys are accepted

      value - The value

      this. Used for the builder pattern

    • compareIgnoreCase

      Restriction<T> compareIgnoreCase(IQueryablePropertyInfo column, Relop op, Object value)
      Compares a character-based column against a character-based value given an operation type.

      String comparisons will be case-insensitive and as configured for linguistic search. Can cause poor performance with columns not marked as supportsLinguisticSearch and without an indexed denorm column.

      Parameters:
      column - The column to compare
      op - The operation
      value - The value
      Returns:
      this. Used for the builder pattern

    • compareIgnoreCase

      Restriction<T> compareIgnoreCase(ColumnRef column, Relop op, Object value)
      Compares a character-based column against a character-based value given an operation type. String comparisons will be case-insensitive and as configured for linguistic search. Can cause poor performance with columns not marked as supportsLinguisticSearch and without an indexed denorm column.
      Parameters:
      column - The column to compare
      op - The operation
      value - The value
      Returns:
      this. Used for the builder pattern

    • compare

      Restriction<T> compare(IQueryablePropertyInfo column, Range range)
      Compares a column against a range.
      Parameters:
      column - The column to compare
      range - the range to compare against. The range may be upper or lower bounder, or a complete range.
      Returns:
      this. Used for the builder pattern

      Returns:
      this. Used for the builder pattern

    • between

      Restriction<T> between(IQueryablePropertyInfo column, Object startValue, Object endValue)
      Compares a column against two values using a between clause. This will throw an exception if either startValue or endValue, or both are null.

      Value types of Key, Bean, and typekeys are accepted

      A value type of DBFunction is handled as well.

      Parameters:
      column - The column to compare
      startValue - The start value of the between
      endValue - The end value of the between
      Returns:
      this. Used for the builder pattern

    • between

      Restriction<T> between(DBFunction column, Object startValue, Object endValue)
      Compares a column wrapped by a SQL function against a value given an operation type.

      Value types of Key, Bean, and typekeys are accepted

      A value type of DBFunction is handled as well.

      Parameters:
      column - The column to compare
      startValue - the start value
      endValue - the end value
      Returns:
      this. Used for the builder pattern

      Compares a varchar column against a string value using a LIKE clause
      Parameters:
      column - The column to compare
      value - The string value to compare using a LIKE clause
      ignoreCase - True to do a case-insensitive search, false if not
      Returns:
      this. Used for the builder pattern

    • startsWith

      Restriction<T> startsWith(IQueryablePropertyInfo column, DBFunction value, boolean ignoreCase)
      Compares a varchar column against a DBFunction.Constant string value using a LIKE clause

      Value types of DBFunction.ConstantFunction that return a string only are accepted

      Parameters:
      column - The column to compare
      value - The DBConstant.Constant string value to compare using a LIKE clause.
      ignoreCase - True to do a case-insensitive search, false if not
      Returns:
      this. Used for the builder pattern

    • contains

      Compares a varchar column against a string value using a contains clause (i.e. column='%string%'
      Parameters:
      column - The column to compare
      value - The value to compare using an in clause
      ignoreCase - True to do a case-insensitive search, false if not
      Returns:
      this. Used for the builder pattern

      Parameters:

      value - The value to compare using an in clause

    • subselect

      Table<T> subselect(IEntityPropertyInfo columnInThisTable, InOperation op, IEntityPropertyInfo columnInJoinTable, SubselectOption... options)
      Joins a table with this table using a sub-select clause.

      Two columns are required, a column in the current table and a column in the join table.

      If the operation is CompareIn, include rows that have a match in the correlated sub-query; if the operation is CompareNotIn, exclude rows that have a match in the correlated sub-query.

      Parameters:
      columnInThisTable - the column in the current table to compare against
      op - the in clause operation
      columnInJoinTable - the column in the joining table
      options - options for constructing the subselect
      Returns:
      the Table being joined to

    • subselect

      Table<T> subselect(DBFunction columnInThisTable, InOperation op, IEntityPropertyInfo columnInJoinTable, SubselectOption... options)
      Joins a table with this table using a sub-select clause.

      Two columns are required, a column in the current table and a column in the join table.

      If the operation is CompareIn, include rows that have a match in the correlated sub-query; if the operation is CompareNotIn, exclude rows that have a match in the correlated sub-query.

      Parameters:
      columnInThisTable - a column in the current table
      op - the in clause operation
      columnInJoinTable - the column in the joining table
      options - options for constructing the subselect
      Returns:
      the Table being joined to

      Joins a column wrapped by a function from table with a column wrapped by a function from another query.

    • and

      Restriction<T> and(BooleanExpression<T> exp)
      Creates a new "and" expression on this restriction.

      All operations on the expression will operate in terms of the condition this expression was passed in to. For example:

      xxx.and(new BooleanExpression<T>() { public void execute(Restriction<T> restriction) { restriction.compare("A", Equals, 10); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 20); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 30); } });

      Will find all things that have (A=10 and A=20 and A=30)

      Parameters:
      exp - a block that adds predicates to the expression tree
      Returns:
      this. Used for the builder pattern

    • or

      Restriction<T> or(BooleanExpression<T> exp)
      Creates a new "or" expression on this restriction.

      All operations on the expression will operate in terms of the condition this expression was passed in to. For example:

      xxx.or(new BooleanExpression<T>() { public void execute(Restriction<T> restriction) { restriction.compare("A", Equals, 10); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 20); restriction.compare("A", Equals, 30); } });

      Will find all things that have (A=10 or A=20 or A=30)

      Parameters:
      exp - a block that adds predicates to the expression tree
      Returns:
      this. Used for the builder pattern

    • withFindRetired

      Table<T> withFindRetired(boolean shouldFind)
      Used to find retired entities. The default is false.
      Parameters:
      shouldFind - true to find retired entities, false to not.
      Returns:
      this instance

    • withFindTemporaryBranches

      Table<T> withFindTemporaryBranches(boolean shouldFind)
      Used to find temporary branches. The default is false.
      Parameters:
      shouldFind - true to find temporary branches, false to not.
      Returns:
      this instance

    • having

      Restriction<T> having()
      Returns:
      the having clause restriction used to add predicates to the having clause part of this search

    • cast

      Table<T> cast(IEntityType subtype)
      Casts this table to the given subtype. This adds a restriction to the query so all result rows from this table are of the given subtype.
      Parameters:
      subtype - a subtype of the current table type
      Returns:
      this. Used for builder pattern

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • getOldTableObjectObject

      @Deprecated com.guidewire.pl.system.database.TableObject getOldTableObjectObject()
      Deprecated.
      This method will be removed in a future release. Do not use. Internal code should use ISimpleQueryBuilderInternal.getOldTableObjectObject() instead. instead.
      Please don't use unless you have to
      Returns:
      the TableObject

    • withinDistance

      Restriction<T> withinDistance(IQueryablePropertyInfo column, SpatialPoint center, Number distance, UnitOfDistance unitOfDistance)
      Searches for points that are 'distance' units from center. The query result is sorted by distance from center in ascending order. Other order by columns may be specified, however distance is always implicitly the first expression in the sort.
      Parameters:
      column - The column to compare. Must be a column of type spatialpoint.
      center - The center of the search
      distance - The distance of the search
      unitOfDistance - The unit of distance @return this. Used for the builder pattern

    • withinDistance

      Restriction<T> withinDistance(IQueryablePropertyInfo column, String beanPathToSpatialColumn, SpatialPoint center, Number distance, UnitOfDistance unitOfDistance)
      Searches for points that are 'distance' units from center. The query result is sorted by distance from center in ascending order. Other order by columns may be specified, however distance is always implicitly the first expression in the sort.
      Parameters:
      column - The column to compare. Must be a column of type spatialpoint.
      beanPathToSpatialColumn - Bean path to spatial column, including root entity. Please specify if the column is not on the root query.
      center - The center of the search
      distance - The distance of the search
      unitOfDistance - The unit of distance @return this. Used for the builder pattern

    • withinDistance

      Restriction<T> withinDistance(ColumnRef column, String beanPathToSpatialColumn, SpatialPoint center, Number distance, UnitOfDistance unitOfDistance)
      Searches for points that are 'distance' units from center. The query result is sorted by distance from center in ascending order. Other order by columns may be specified, however distance is always implicitly the first expression in the sort.
      Parameters:
      column - The column to compare. Must be a column of type spatialpoint.
      beanPathToSpatialColumn - Bean path to spatial column, including root entity.
      center - The center of the search
      distance - The distance of the search
      unitOfDistance - The unit of distance @return this. Used for the builder pattern

    • withinPolygon

      Restriction<T> withinPolygon(IQueryablePropertyInfo column, boolean findIn, SpatialPolygon polygon)
      Searches for points that are within or not within the given polygon. Points on the boundary of the polygon are considered within. Note that this method is overloaded to allow searching of either points in a given polygon or polygons that contain a given point.
      Parameters:
      column - The column to compare. Must be a column of type spatialpoint.
      findIn - true for finding points in the polygon; false for finding points outside the polygons.
      polygon - the polygon to search
      Returns:
      this. Used for the builder pattern

    • withinPolygon

      Restriction<T> withinPolygon(IQueryablePropertyInfo column, String beanPathToSpatialColumn, boolean findIn, SpatialPolygon polygon)
      Searches for points that are within or not within the given polygon. Points on the boundary of the polygon are considered within. Note that this method is overloaded to allow searching of either points in a given polygon or polygons that contain a given point.
      Parameters:
      column - The column to compare. Must be a column of type spatialpoint.
      beanPathToSpatialColumn - Bean path to spatial column, including root entity. Please specify if the column is not on the root query.
      findIn - true for finding points in the polygon; false for finding points outside the polygons.
      polygon - the polygon to search
      Returns:
      this. Used for the builder pattern

    • withinPolygon

      Restriction<T> withinPolygon(ColumnRef column, String beanPathToSpatialColumn, boolean findIn, SpatialPolygon polygon)
      Searches for points that are within or not within the given polygon. Points on the boundary of the polygon are considered within. Note that this method is overloaded to allow searching of either points in a given polygon or polygons that contain a given point.
      Parameters:
      column - The column to compare. Must be a column of type spatialpoint.
      beanPathToSpatialColumn - Bean path to spatial column, including root entity.
      findIn - true for finding points in the polygon; false for finding points outside the polygons.
      polygon - the polygon to search
      Returns:
      this. Used for the builder pattern

    • withinPolygon

      Restriction<T> withinPolygon(IQueryablePropertyInfo column, boolean findIn, SpatialPoint point)
      Searches for polygons that contain or do not contain the given point. Points on the boundary of the polygon are considered within. Note that this method is overloaded to allow searching of either points in a given polygon or polygons that contain a given point.
      Parameters:
      column - The column to compare. Must be a column of type spatialpoint.
      findIn - true for finding points in the polygon; false for finding points outside the polygons.
      point - the point to use for the search
      Returns:
      this. Used for the builder pattern

    • withinPolygon

      Restriction<T> withinPolygon(IQueryablePropertyInfo column, String beanPathToSpatialColumn, boolean findIn, SpatialPoint point)
      Searches for polygons that contain or do not contain the given point. Points on the boundary of the polygon are considered within. Note that this method is overloaded to allow searching of either points in a given polygon or polygons that contain a given point.
      Parameters:
      column - The column to compare. Must be a column of type spatialpoint.
      beanPathToSpatialColumn - Bean path to spatial column, including root entity. Please specify if the column is not on the root query.
      findIn - true for finding points in the polygon; false for finding points outside the polygons.
      point - the point to use for the search
      Returns:
      this. Used for the builder pattern

    • withinPolygon

    • withinPolygonBuffer

      Restriction<T> withinPolygonBuffer(IQueryablePropertyInfo column, boolean findIn, SpatialPolygon polygon, Number distance, UnitOfDistance unitOfDistance)
      Searches for points that are within or not within the given polygon buffer. Points on the boundary of the polygon are considered within.
      Parameters:
      column - The column to compare. Must be a column of type spatialpoint.
      findIn - true for finding points in the polygon; false for finding points outside the polygons.
      polygon - the polygon to search
      distance - the distance for the buffer
      unitOfDistance - unit of distance
      Returns:
      this. Used for the builder pattern

    • withinPolygonBuffer
